Ada Masalah Mesin, Helikopter Presiden Bolivia Mendarat Darurat
05 Nov 2019, 08:58 by Novi Christiastuti
Sucre - Sebuah helikopter yang membawa Presiden Bolivia, Evo Morales, terpaksa melakukan pendaratan darurat. Insiden ini memicu kecurigaan di kalangan pendukung Morales setelah rival-rival politiknya bersumpah untuk melengserkannya.
Seperti dilansir AFP, Selasa (5/11/2019), militer Bolivia menuturkan bahwa helikopter jenis EC-145 yang membawa Presiden Morales terpaksa mendarat darurat pada Senin (4/11) waktu setempat, karena adanya masalah mesin. Tidak ada korban luka dalam insiden tersebut.
Namun insiden itu semakin menambah ketegangan di Bolivia, saat demonstran memprotes Morales selama dua pekan terakhir terkait sengketa pemilu.
Diketahui bahwa aksi protes mencuat setelah Morales dinyatakan sebagai pemenang pemilu 20 Oktober lalu yang memberikannya periode keempat sebagai Presiden Bolivia. Rival-rival politik Morales menuduh hasil pemilu itu penuh kecurangan, dengan menyoroti adanya keganjilan dalam penghitungan suara.
Masalah mesin yang dialami helikopter yang membawa Presiden Morales terjadi saat helikopter itu lepas landas dari sebuah desa di wilayah Andes, setelah Morales meresmikan ruas jalanan baru di sana. Video insiden itu beredar luar di media sosial.
"Saudara-saudara, hari ini, setelah meresmikan jalan di Colquiri, kami mengalami insiden dengan helikopter yang akan diselidiki secara pantas," tulis Morales via akun Twitternya usai insiden tersebut.

There's a Engine Problem, Bolivia's President Helicopter Landing Emergency
05 Nov 2019, 08:58 by Novi Christiastuti
Sucre - A helicopter carrying Bolivian President, Evo Morales, was forced to make an emergency landing. The incident sparked suspicion among Morales supporters after his political rivals swore to oust him.
As reported by AFP on Tuesday (11/05/2019), the Bolivian military said that the EC-145 helicopter carrying President Morales was forced to make an emergency landing on Monday (4/11) local time, due to an engine problem. There were no injuries in the incident.
But the incident further added to tensions in Bolivia, as demonstrators protested against Morales over the past two weeks over election disputes.
It is known that protests erupted after Morales was declared the winner of the October 20 election which gave him the fourth term as President of Bolivia. Morales' political rivals accused the election results of being fraudulent, highlighting the peculiarities of vote counting.
The engine problem experienced by the helicopter carrying President Morales occurred when the helicopter took off from a village in the Andes region, after Morales inaugurated a new road section there. The video of the incident circulated outside on social media.
"Ladies and gentlemen, today, after inaugurating the road in Colquiri, we have an incident with a helicopter that will be properly investigated," Morales wrote via his Twitter account after the incident.
